video.title: Crimes of the Century
video.synopsis: Never-before-seen footage and exclusive interviews offer a virtual scene-of-the-crime vantage point for history's most major news events.

episodes.synopsis: In 2002, a sniper terrorized the residents of Washington, D.C., and its suburbs by randomly targeting ordinary citizens in common public places.
episodes.title: DC Sniper

episodes.synopsis: In 1980, the world was stunned by the murder of former Beatle John Lennon. Was Mark David Chapman a cold-blooded killer or a deranged young man?
episodes.title: John Lennon Assassination

episodes.synopsis: In 2001, Andrea Yates drowned her five small children in the bathtub. Her bizarre explanation of why she did it: to save her children from Satan.
episodes.title: Andrea Yates

episodes.synopsis: In 1981, a gunman fires shots at Ronald Reagan, prompting an urgent investigation to find out if this is a wider plot or the work of a lone assassin.
episodes.title: Reagan Assassination Attempt

episodes.synopsis: In 1995, a federal building in Oklahoma City was torn apart by a powerful truck bomb, killing 168 people. Was this part of a much larger conspiracy?
episodes.title: Oklahoma City Bombing

episodes.synopsis: This episode examines the case of Amanda Knox, an American exchange student living in Italy who was arrested and tried for the murder of her roommate.
episodes.title: Amanda Knox

episodes.synopsis: The 1993 siege at the Branch Davidian compound in Waco, Texas, captured America's attention and changed the ATF and the FBI.
episodes.title: Waco

episodes.synopsis: For nearly two decades, "Unabomber" Ted Kaczynski terrorized college campuses and those involved with modern technology through a series of bombings.
episodes.title: Unabomber
